summary: This bill, the Living Organ Donor Tax Credit Act, amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a refundable tax credit for individuals who donate life-saving organs. The credit covers costs related to transplantation, including medical expenses, travel, lodging, lost wages, and legal fees, up to $5,000.  The bill also includes amendments to the Public Health Service Act and National Organ Transplant Act to coordinate with federal grants and clarify that the tax credit does not constitute unlawful compensation. The amendments take effect after the date of enactment.
